mainPackage

Class UPC_Decode

  • java.lang.Object
    • mainPackage.UPC_Decode

  • public class UPC_Decode
extends java.lang.Object
    Automatically decodes the given barcode to UPC format
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Zach Swanson

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String barcode
      barcode passed to the constructor
      private java.lang.String[][] key
      encoded equivalents of each UPC code number, in the format [upc number][left (0) or right (1) of center]
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> keyMap
      contains all possible number encodings (even- and odd-parity) as keys and their equivalent numbers as values for easy lookup
      private java.lang.String upc
      decoded UPC code

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UPC_Decode(java.lang.String barcode)
      Constructs a new UPC_Decode with this barcode and calls populateHashMap, decode, and verifyChecksum

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private java.lang.String checkIfBackward(java.lang.String barcode)
      Checks if barcode was scanned in correct direction, reverses barcode if not
      private void decode()
      Makes sure this barcode is valid length, reverses if the barcode was "scanned" backwards, decodes the barcode to UPC format
      java.lang.String getBarcode()
      Returns the original barcode
      java.lang.String getUPC()
      Returns the decoded UPC
      private void populateHashMap()
      Populates HashMap used for easy lookup while decoding
      private boolean verifyChecksum()
      Verifies checksum of barcode to ensure there were no errors in reading

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        decoded UPC code

      • barcode

        private java.lang.String barcode
        barcode passed to the constructor

      • keyMap

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> keyMap
        contains all possible number encodings (even- and odd-parity) as keys and their equivalent numbers as values for easy lookup

      • key

        private java.lang.String[][] key
        encoded equivalents of each UPC code number, in the format [upc number][left (0) or right (1) of center]

    • Constructor Detail

      • UPC_Decode

        UPC_Decode(java.lang.String barcode)
        Constructs a new UPC_Decode with this barcode and calls populateHashMap, decode, and verifyChecksum
        Parameters:
        barcode - the barcode to decode

    • Method Detail

      • getBarcode

        public java.lang.String getBarcode()
        Returns the original barcode
        Returns:
        this barcode passed to constructor

      • getUPC

        public java.lang.String getUPC()
        Returns the decoded UPC
        Returns:
        this decoded UPC

      • decode

        private void decode()
        Makes sure this barcode is valid length, reverses if the barcode was "scanned" backwards, decodes the barcode to UPC format

      • verifyChecksum

        private boolean verifyChecksum()
        Verifies checksum of barcode to ensure there were no errors in reading
        Returns:
        true if barcode checksum is correct, otherwise false

      • populateHashMap

        private void populateHashMap()
        Populates HashMap used for easy lookup while decoding

      • checkIfBackward

        private java.lang.String checkIfBackward(java.lang.String barcode)
        Checks if barcode was scanned in correct direction, reverses barcode if not
        Parameters:
        barcode - the barcode to check
        Returns:
        original barcode if correct direction, reversed barcode if barcode was scanned upside down
